speaker: SERVANT
text: I have told my lord of you. He is coming

speaker: SERVANT
text: down to you.

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text: I thank you, sir.

speaker: SERVANT
text: Here’s my lord.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: One of Lord Timon’s men? A gift, I

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: warrant. Why, this hits right. I dreamt of a silver

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: basin and ewer tonight.—Flaminius, honest

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: Flaminius, you are very respectively welcome, sir.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text:
(
                To
                 
                Servant
                .
                )
               Fill me some wine.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: And how does that honorable, complete, free-hearted

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: gentleman of Athens, thy very bountiful

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: good lord and master?

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text: His health is well, sir.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: I am right glad that his health is well, sir.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: And what hast thou there under thy cloak, pretty

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: Flaminius?

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text: Faith, nothing but an empty box, sir, which

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text: in my lord’s behalf I come to entreat your Honor

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text: to supply; who, having great and instant occasion

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text: to use fifty talents, hath sent to your Lordship to

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text: furnish him, nothing doubting your present assistance

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text: therein.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: La, la, la, la. “Nothing doubting” says he?

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: Alas, good lord! A noble gentleman ’tis, if he would

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: not keep so good a house. Many a time and often I

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: ha’ dined with him and told him on ’t, and come

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: again to supper to him of purpose to have him

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: spend less, and yet he would embrace no counsel,

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: take no warning by my coming. Every man has his

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: fault, and honesty is his. I ha’ told him on ’t, but I

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: could ne’er get him from ’t.

speaker: SERVANT
text: Please your Lordship, here is the wine.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: Flaminius, I have noted thee always wise.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: Here’s to thee.

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text: Your Lordship speaks your pleasure.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: I have observed thee always for a towardly

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: prompt spirit—give thee thy due—and one that

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: knows what belongs to reason and canst use the

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: time well, if the time use thee well. Good parts in

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: thee.—Get you gone, sirrah.

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: Draw nearer, honest Flaminius. Thy lord’s a bountiful

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: gentleman, but thou art wise and thou

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: know’st well enough, although thou com’st to me,

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: that this is no time to lend money, especially upon

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: bare friendship, without security. Here’s three solidares

speaker: LUCULLUS
text:
for thee.
                 
                (
                Gives
                 
                him
                 
                money
                .
                )
               Good boy,

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: wink at me, and say thou saw’st me not. Fare thee

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: well.

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
Is
               
              ’t
               
              possible
               
              the
               
              world
               
              should
               
              so
               
              much
               
              differ
              ,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
And
               
              we
               
              alive
               
              that
               
              lived
              ?
               
              Fly
              ,
               
              damnèd
               
              baseness
              ,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
To
               
              him
               
              that
               
              worships
               
              thee
              !

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: Ha! Now I see thou art a fool and fit for thy

speaker: LUCULLUS
text: master.

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
May
               
              these
               
              add
               
              to
               
              the
               
              number
               
              that
               
              may
               
              scald
               
              thee
              !

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
Let
               
              molten
               
              coin
               
              be
               
              thy
               
              damnation
              ,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
Thou
               
              disease
               
              of
               
              a
               
              friend
               
              and
               
              not
               
              himself
              !

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
Has
               
              friendship
               
              such
               
              a
               
              faint
               
              and
               
              milky
               
              heart

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
It
               
              turns
               
              in
               
              less
               
              than
               
              two
               
              nights
              ?
               
              O
               
              you
               
              gods
              ,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
I
               
              feel
               
              my
               
              master’s
               
              passion
              .
               
              This
               
              slave

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
Unto
               
              his
               
              honor
               
              has
               
              my
               
              lord’s
               
              meat
               
              in
               
              him
              .

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
Why
               
              should
               
              it
               
              thrive
               
              and
               
              turn
               
              to
               
              nutriment

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
When
               
              he
               
              is
               
              turned
               
              to
               
              poison
              ?

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
O
              ,
               
              may
               
              diseases
               
              only
               
              work
               
              upon
               
              ’t
              ,

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
And
               
              when
               
              he’s
               
              sick
               
              to
               
              death
              ,
               
              let
               
              not
               
              that
               
              part
               
              of
               
              nature

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
Which
               
              my

              paid
               
              for
               
              be
               
              of
               
              any

speaker: FLAMINIUS
text:
To
               
              expel
               
              sickness
              ,
               
              but

              his

              .
